title: Additional soil remediation
description: Unexpected contaminated soil discovered in northeast quadrant requiring additional environmental remediation and soil disposal at certified facility.

title: Upgraded HVAC controls
description: Owner requested upgrade from standard BAS to integrated smart building controls with energy monitoring and predictive maintenance capability.

title: Exhibition hall floor reinforcement
description: Structural engineer required additional reinforcement for exhibition hall floor slab to accommodate heavier equipment loads per revised loading criteria.

title: Added emergency generator
description: Fire marshal required addition of second emergency generator for life safety systems in exhibition halls per updated code interpretation.

title: Premium curtain wall finish
description: Architect specified upgraded curtain wall finish from standard anodized to custom bronze fluoropolymer coating to match city design guidelines.

title: Longer pile lengths
description: Test pile results indicate production piles need to be driven 12 feet deeper than design depth to achieve required capacity in marine clay.

title: Marine environmental mitigation
description: Additional turbidity curtains and marine monitoring required per revised environmental permit conditions from Army Corps of Engineers.

title: Bridge deck high-performance concrete
description: TxDOT required upgrade from standard Class S concrete to high-performance HPC with silica fume for improved durability and 75-year service life.

title: Additional seismic restraints
description: Revised seismic analysis required additional bracing and restraints at piers 3 and 4 per updated AASHTO specifications.

title: MRI suite shielding upgrade
description: Radiology department requested upgrade from standard RF shielding to enhanced 5-layer shielding for 3T MRI suite per equipment manufacturer requirements.

title: Additional fire sprinkler coverage
description: Fire marshal required extended sprinkler coverage in attic spaces above suspended ceilings per NFPA 13 2022 edition requirements.

title: Hurricane impact windows upgrade
description: Insurance carrier required upgrade to large missile impact-rated windows and doors on all levels per revised wind zone classification.
